data.title: Magnificent portrait vase of King Frederick William IV aâ€¦
data.meta_description:
Magnificent portrait vase of King Frederick William IV and his wife Elisabeth Luise as crown prince couple from KPM Berlin.
Above square plinth with raised circular foot, amphora-shaped body with rounded shoulder, stepped, indented neck and wide sweeping, profiled rim. Laterally set, curled rosette handles rising from palmette reliefs. Royal blue background with speckled gold accents. Medallion reserve recessed on both sides of the wall, surrounded by wide gold rim. The medallion contains the bust portrait of Frederick William IV as Crown Prince (1795 - 1861) in uniform with breast star (Order of the Black Eagle) and Iron Cross and of his wife Elisabeth Luise of Bavaria (1801 - 1873), eldest daughter of King Maximilian I Joseph of Bavaria, in extremely fine grisaille painting. Rich gilding. Form design Karl Friedrich Schinkel, c. 1820 - 1830. painter's mark. Minim. rest.; scepter and painter's mark. H. 48 cm. 
A splendid royal blue ground porcelain portrait vase of King Frederick IV of Prussia and his wife Elisabeth Luise of Bavaria as crown prince couple. Minor restored. Painter's sign. Sceptre and painter's mark.
KPM-Berlin. Around 1832 - 1837.
